item.title: If(q1 == 0); error
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

if (q1 == 0) { sendQuest("Ghost's Scare", 7332); if (q1 > 0) { sendQuest("@yel@Ghost's Scare", 7332); if (q1 == 15) { sendQuest("@gre@Ghost's Scare", 7332); } } }

You have to close each if statement with an ending bracket, that’s why you got 100 errors.

Read full topic

item.title: If(q1 == 0); error
item.dc:creator: @jarnohhh jarnohhh
item.description:
@jarnohhh wrote:

[quote=“Gods army, post:14, topic:256143”]let me teach you something… in java whenever you have a { you must have a } following somewhere.

say you have this code

public void method29(int i) { anInt2678++; if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex != 1000) { Class97.getLoopCycle++; if ((Class97.getLoopCycle % 1000 ^ 0xffffffff) == -2) { GregorianCalendar gregoriancalendar = new GregorianCalendar(); Class30_Sub9_Sub5.anInt4219 = (gregoriancalendar.get(11) * 600 - -(10 * gregoriancalendar.get(12)) - -(gregoriancalendar.get(13) / 6)); Class30_Sub6_Sub13.aRandom4035 .setSeed((long) Class30_Sub9_Sub5.anInt4219); } method41(97); if (i > -111) aClass63_2667 = null; if (Class30_Sub14.aClass31_2975 != null) Class30_Sub14.aClass31_2975.method1019((byte) 115); Class30_Sub6_Sub7.method442(-128); Class30_Sub9_Sub19.method667((byte) 83); Class90.method1526(89); Class69.method1262((byte) 33); if (Class30_Sub9_Sub10.aClass132_4299 != null) { int i_54_ = Class30_Sub9_Sub10.aClass132_4299.method1831((byte) -58); Class30_Sub6_Sub6.anInt3900 = i_54_; } if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex != 0) { if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -6) { if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 25 || Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 28) Class5.method100((byte) 20); } else { method46((byte) -95); Class135.method1851(0); } } else { method46((byte) -119); Class135.method1851(0); } if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -11) { if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -31) { if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 40) { Class69.method1266(126); if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) != 2) { if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) == -16) Class30_Sub9_Sub11.method634((byte) 83); else if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) != -3) ItemDef.method69(0); } } } else GroundData.method80(-20895); } else { method38(0); Class30_Sub6_Sub19.method546(-3); Class49.method1109(123); Class69.method1266(126); } } }

every { has a partner, if you have 7 { you will have 7 } or you will get errors, if you have 5 { you will have 5 }… understand?[/quote]

can you explain taht

item.title: If(q1 == 0); error
item.dc:creator: @Gods_army Gods army
item.description:
@Gods_army wrote:

let me teach you something… in java whenever you have a { you must have a } following somewhere.

say you have this code

public void method29(int i) { anInt2678++; if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex != 1000) { Class97.getLoopCycle++; if ((Class97.getLoopCycle % 1000 ^ 0xffffffff) == -2) { GregorianCalendar gregoriancalendar = new GregorianCalendar(); Class30_Sub9_Sub5.anInt4219 = (gregoriancalendar.get(11) * 600 - -(10 * gregoriancalendar.get(12)) - -(gregoriancalendar.get(13) / 6)); Class30_Sub6_Sub13.aRandom4035 .setSeed((long) Class30_Sub9_Sub5.anInt4219); } method41(97); if (i > -111) aClass63_2667 = null; if (Class30_Sub14.aClass31_2975 != null) Class30_Sub14.aClass31_2975.method1019((byte) 115); Class30_Sub6_Sub7.method442(-128); Class30_Sub9_Sub19.method667((byte) 83); Class90.method1526(89); Class69.method1262((byte) 33); if (Class30_Sub9_Sub10.aClass132_4299 != null) { int i_54_ = Class30_Sub9_Sub10.aClass132_4299.method1831((byte) -58); Class30_Sub6_Sub6.anInt3900 = i_54_; } if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex != 0) { if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -6) { if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 25 || Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 28) Class5.method100((byte) 20); } else { method46((byte) -95); Class135.method1851(0); } } else { method46((byte) -119); Class135.method1851(0); } if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -11) { if ((Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex ^ 0xffffffff) != -31) { if (Class83_Sub1.getLoginIndex == 40) { Class69.method1266(126); if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) != 2) { if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) == -16) Class30_Sub9_Sub11.method634((byte) 83); else if ((Class137.anInt2422 ^ 0xffffffff) != -3) ItemDef.method69(0); } } } else GroundData.method80(-20895); } else { method38(0); Class30_Sub6_Sub19.method546(-3); Class49.method1109(123); Class69.method1266(126); } } }

every { has a partner, if you have 7 { you will have 7 } or you will get errors, if you have 5 { you will have 5 }… understand?

item.title: If(q1 == 0); error
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

grimreaper61:

the i is not capitalized…little things like that make a difference. Tbh delta and devo are basically the same thing lol. Just make the I lowercase and it will work

GL fixing it
OH and
if(q1 == 0) {
not
if(q1 == 0);

_Vengeance:

Close your brackets…

that too.

item.title: If(q1 == 0); error
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

[quote=“lolwut69, post:8, topic:256143”][quote author=jarnohhh link=topic=338372.msg2625956#msg2625956 date=1231791226]

[quote author=lolwut69 link=topic=338372.msg2625951#msg2625951 date=1231791181]
Why did you combine a method call and an if statement into one?..
[/quote] uhm? How would you do it?
[/quote]Instead of if(q1 == 0); I would do it like it’s supposed to be done with if (q1 == 0) { and an ending bracket after the if statement.[/quote]
yep lol missed that…i just saw the upper case Is. When in doubt put it in brackets :P. If a line starts with “if” end it in a bracket then close the end of the code for that if statement in another bracket.

Read full topic

[code] sendQuest(“NO TELEPORT”, 13071);

sendQuest("@gre@0/0", 13078);
If(q1 == 0);
sendQuest(“Ghost’s Scare”, 7332);
If(q1 > 0);
sendQuest("@yel@Ghost’s Scare", 7332);

	// main
	sendFrame126("", 7334);
	sendFrame126("", 7335);[/code]
